intro: Zosterophyllanthos bulbosus, commonly known as the bulbous zosterophyllum, is a unique plant with distinctive botanical features. It belongs to the family Zosterophyllaceae and is characterized by its bulb-like structures that serve as storage organs. The plant exhibits a semi-succulent morphology, with thick, fleshy leaves adapted to arid environments. Its reproductive structures are simple, consisting of small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Zosterophyllanthos bulbosus is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
